title: MUSIC Model-Based Mathematical Analysis and Instructional Design Optimization Methodology for Measuring Student Pharmacist Motivation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational pharmaceutical knowledge, basic instructional design concepts, and basic statistical and data interpretation skills (mean, variance, graph comprehension)
context.additional_context: For current practitioners, processing MUSIC model survey data with math-based analysis tools (SPSS, Excel, etc.) to identify motivation patterns and strengthen the capability to adjust educational design accordingly.

learning_goals: Learners quantitatively measure student pharmacists' motivation levels by processing MUSIC model-based survey data using mathematical statistical techniques (mean, standard deviation, correlation analysis).
Learners derive educational design improvement directions through graphical visualization and probabilistic analysis of survey results.
Learners establish personalized instructional strategies via linear equation modeling based on motivation measurement data in a PBL environment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
